src.temperature package

Submodules

src.temperature.advanced module

Temperature conversion module with unit validation and experimental features.

class src.temperature.advanced.TemperatureConverter[source]

Bases: object

A class for converting between temperature units with validation.

static convert(temp: float, from_unit: str, to_unit: str) → float[source]

Convert between temperature units with validation and warnings.

Parameters:

  • temp (float) – Temperature value to convert.

  • from_unit (str) – Source temperature unit. One of: ‘C’, ‘F’, ‘K’.

  • to_unit (str) – Target temperature unit. One of: ‘C’, ‘F’, ‘K’.

Returns:

Converted temperature value.

Return type:

float

Raises:

ValueError – If invalid units or conversion paths are provided.

src.temperature.converter module

Temperature conversion functions between Celsius and Fahrenheit.

src.temperature.faulty module

Temperature Conversion Module with Intentional Errors for Testing.

class src.temperature.faulty.FaultyTemperatureConverter[source]

Bases: TemperatureConverter

A converter that intentionally introduces errors for testing purposes.

calibration_error

An intentional error offset to apply to conversions.

calibration_error = 0
classmethod convert(temp: float, from_unit: str, to_unit: str) → float[source]

Convert temperature between units with intentional errors.

Parameters:

  • temp (float) – Temperature value to convert.

  • from_unit (str) – Original temperature unit (case-sensitive).

  • to_unit (str) – Target temperature unit (case-sensitive).

Returns:

Converted temperature value with intentional errors.

Return type:

float

classmethod init_settings() → None[source]

Initialize converter settings by loading calibration error from config.

Returns:

This method doesn’t return anything meaningful.

Return type:

None
